title: 'Halloween Kills' star Jamie Lee Curtis shares first look at new 'battle for my life'
text:
CLOSE Jamie Lee Curtis returns as Laurie Strode in "Halloween." She talks to USA TODAY about the (in)famous mask worn by the murderous Michael Myers. Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY

Jamie Lee Curtis is looking bruised but beaming.

The actress took to Twitter Tuesday to give fans a sneak peak of what they can expect in her upcoming film "Halloween Kills," the latest installment in the "Halloween" slasher series.

And from the looks of the photo she posted, fighting for your life doesn't seem too pretty, with Curtis rocking cuts on her face, bruises on her arms and grime in her hair.

"NEVER SAY DIE! First day back in the battle for my life!" she wrote, adding the hashtags "Halloween" and "HalloweenKills" and tagging the "Halloween Kills" Twitter account in a reply.

Curtis, 60, had one of her breakout roles in the original "Halloween" film in 1978, starring as Laurie. She went on to reprise the role in several subsequent films in the horror franchise, like "Halloween II," "Halloween H20: 20 Years Later," "Halloween: Resurrection" and the 2018 "Halloween."

Curtis also made a cameo in 1982's "Halloween III: Season of the Witch."

More: All of the 'Halloween' movies, ranked (including the new Jamie Lee Curtis sequel)

According to IMDB, the next film in the series, "Halloween Ends," has already been announced.

"Halloween Kills" stars Curtis alongside Judy Greer, Andi Matichak, Kyle Richards and Anthony Michael Hall.

In the original "Halloween," Laurie, 17, once a promising, curious, college-bound teen, "became a freak," after Michael's killing spree, Curtis told USA TODAY in 2018. The "Halloween" movie released last year bookends the causal effect of Laurie's nightmare, offering a very 2018 twist in its bloody finale. "It was beautiful to watch what happened with Laurie Strode and her daughter and her granddaughter and watch three women take back the power from a perpetrator," she said.
